metadata.title: How to Write YouTube Descriptions 2025: SEO Guide
metadata.description: Write effective YouTube video descriptions. SEO optimization, structure, and best practices.

hero.headline: How to Write YouTube Descriptions
hero.subheadline: Descriptions help search and context. Structure them right for SEO and viewer value.

sections.content: YouTube descriptions are prime SEO real estate. The first 150 characters show in search results, and the full description helps YouTube understand your content. A well-structured description improves discoverability and provides value to viewers.

content.title: Hook (First 150 chars)
content.description: Shows in search. Include main keyword. Compelling summary.

content.title: Main Description
content.description: Detailed video overview. Natural keyword inclusion. Value proposition.

content.title: Links & Resources
content.description: Products mentioned, social links, related content. Affiliate opportunities.

sections.title: Writing Process
content: Summarize video value in first sentence
Expand on what viewers will learn

content.title: Keyword Placement
content.description: Primary keyword in first 25 words. Natural, not stuffed.

content.title: Hashtags
content.description: 3-5 relevant hashtags. First 3 show above title.

content.title: Timestamps
content.description: Chapter markers. Improves search and user experience.

faq.question: How long should descriptions be?
faq.answer: Minimum 200-300 words recommended. Use the spaceâ€”it's free SEO. But quality over length. Don't pad with fluff.

faq.question: Do descriptions affect ranking?
faq.answer: Yes, but less than title and watch time. Descriptions help YouTube understand context and appear in search. Worth optimizing.

faq.question: Should I use timestamps?
faq.answer: Yes. Creates chapters in video player, improves UX, and can appear in Google search results. Easy win.

faq.question: What about default descriptions?
faq.answer: Set up a default with common links, social media, channel info. Then customize the top portion for each video.
